posts.post_content:
He's a perfect one-drop, but that's what worries me; image drawing a 0/1 on turn five. Ouch. I realize Simic can easily build him up with all the 1+/+1 counter engines it has, but Evolve looks like a double-edged sword to me.  
  
Still better than poor Cipher though.

And yes, as a lot of Evolve cards, this is ideal "on the curve", but not good afterwards. But hey, simic has some ways to distribute counters. Plus, it's not as if this particular flaw is only present in creatures with Evolve...

posts.post_content: Everyone knows this is typically your best one-drop in Simic, but what a lot of people apparently miss about him is that even late-game he's at least viable if you're utilizing [Master Biomancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Biomancer) correctly. Even if your Biomancer has no counters on him, this thing is still a 2/3 flyer for U, which is not strictly worse than [Insectile Aberration](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Insectile Aberration).
posts.html:

Posted By: Oatbran (2/18/2013 5:16:22 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I still love this card ALOT even though I just had my view on evolve crushed last night. Actually re-reading the effect I can see how I was wrong. I was thinking if either the power OR the toughness was higher than either it's power or toughness it would evolve. Example: Cloudfin Raptor, I play one and then I play another, because his toughness is higher than his power I would then trigger evolve. I am sad to find out that I was wrong, this is much fairer than my interpretation of the effect. Far less powerful than I had envisioned it but it still gets an A+ in my book to power up the more you fill out your curve.
posts.html:
